 47
 48
 49// Block-vector parallel assignment.
 50template <dimension_type Dim,
 51	  typename       T1,
 52	  typename       T2,
 53	  typename       Block1,
 54	  typename       Block2>
 55class Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Blkvec_assign>
 56  : Compile_time_assert<Is_split_block<Block1>::value ==
 57                        Is_split_block<Block2>::value>
 58{
 59  static dimension_type const dim = Dim;
 60
 61  // disable_copy should only be set to true for testing purposes.  It
 62  // disables direct copy of data when source and destination are on
 63  // the same processor, causing chains to be built on both sides.
 64  // This is helps cover chain-to-chain copies for par-services-none.
 65  static bool const disable_copy = false;
 66
 67  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block1>::type dst_local_block;
 68  typedef typename Distributed_local_block<Block2>::type src_local_block;
 69
 70  typedef typename View_of_dim<dim, T1, dst_local_block>::type
 71		dst_lview_type;
 72
 73  typedef typename View_of_dim<dim, T2, src_local_block>::const_type
 74		src_lview_type;
 75
 76  typedef typename Block_layout<src_local_block>::layout_type raw_src_lp;
 77  typedef typename Block_layout<dst_local_block>::layout_type raw_dst_lp;
 78
 79  typedef typename Adjust_layout_pack<Stride_unit_dense, raw_src_lp>::type
 80		src_lp;
 81  typedef typename Adjust_layout_pack<Stride_unit_dense, raw_dst_lp>::type
 82		dst_lp;
 83
 84  typedef impl::Persistent_ext_data<src_local_block, src_lp> src_ext_type;
 85  typedef impl::Persistent_ext_data<dst_local_block, dst_lp> dst_ext_type;
 86
 87  typedef typename Block1::map_type dst_appmap_t;
 88  typedef typename Block2::map_type src_appmap_t;
 89
 90  typedef typename Block_layout<Block1>::order_type dst_order_t;
 91
 92  typedef impl::Communicator::request_type request_type;
 93  typedef impl::Communicator::chain_type   chain_type;
 94
 95  /// A Msg_record holds a piece of a data transfer that together
 96  /// describe a complete communication.
 97  ///
 98  /// Members:
 99  ///   PROC_ is the remote processor (to send to or receive from),
100  ///   SUBBLOCK_ is the local subblock to,
101  ///   DATA_ is the raw data pointer of the local subblock,
102  ///   CHAIN_ is the DMA chain representing the data from subblock_
103  ///      to send.
104  ///
105  /// Notes:
106  ///   [1] CHAIN_ completely describes the data to send/receive,
107  ///       but it is dependent on the distributed blocks storage
108  ///       location remaining unchanged from when the list is built
109  ///       to when it is executed.  SUBBLOCK_ and DATA_ are stored
110  ///       to check consistentcy and potentially update CHAIN_ if
111  ///       the storage location changes.
112
113  struct Msg_record
114  {
115    Msg_record(processor_type proc, index_type sb, stride_type offset,
116	       length_type size)
117      : proc_    (proc),
118        subblock_(sb),
119	offset_  (offset),
120	size_    (size)
121      {}
122
123  public:
124    processor_type      proc_;    // destination processor
125    index_type          subblock_;
126    stride_type         offset_;
127    length_type         size_;
128  };
129
130
131
132  /// A Copy_record holds part of a data transfer where the source
133  /// and destination processors are the same.
134  ///
135  /// Members:
136  ///   SRC_SB_ is the source local subblock,
137  ///   DST_SB_ is the destination local subblock,
138  ///   SRC_DOM_ is the local domain within the source subblock to transfer,
139  ///   DST_DOM_ is the local domain within the destination subblock to
140  ///      transfer.
141
142  struct Copy_record
143  {
144    Copy_record(index_type src_sb, index_type dst_sb,
145	       Domain<Dim> src_dom,
146	       Domain<Dim> dst_dom)
147      : src_sb_  (src_sb),
148        dst_sb_  (dst_sb),
149	src_dom_ (src_dom),
150	dst_dom_ (dst_dom)
151      {}
152
153  public:
154    index_type     src_sb_;    // destination processor
155    index_type     dst_sb_;
156    Domain<Dim>    src_dom_;
157    Domain<Dim>    dst_dom_;
158  };
159
160
161  // Constructor.
162public:
163  Par_assign(
164    typename View_of_dim<Dim, T1, Block1>::type       dst,
165    typename View_of_dim<Dim, T2, Block2>::const_type src)
166    : dst_      (dst),
167      src_      (src.block()),
168      dst_am_   (dst_.block().map()),
169      src_am_   (src_.block().map()),
170      comm_     (dst_am_.impl_comm()),
171      send_list (),
172      recv_list (),
173      copy_list (),
174      req_list  (),
175      msg_count (0),
176      src_ext_  (src_.local().block(), impl::SYNC_IN),
177      dst_ext_  (dst_.local().block(), impl::SYNC_OUT)
178  {
179    profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Blkvec_assign>-cons");
180    assert(src_am_.impl_comm() == dst_am_.impl_comm());
181
182    build_send_list();
183    if (!disable_copy)
184      build_copy_list();
185    build_recv_list();
186  }
187
188  ~Par_assign()
189  {
190    // At destruction, the list of outstanding sends should be empty.
191    // This would be non-empty if:
192    //  - Par_assign did not to clear the lists after
193    //    processing it (library design error), or
194    //  - User executed send() without a corresponding wait().
195    assert(req_list.size() == 0);
196  }
197
198
199  // Implementation functions.
200private:
201
202  void build_send_list();
203  void build_recv_list();
204  void build_copy_list();
205
206  void exec_send_list();
207  void exec_recv_list();
208  void exec_copy_list();
209
210  void wait_send_list();
211
212  void cleanup() {}	// Cleanup send_list buffers.
213
214
215  // Invoke the parallel assignment
216public:
217  void operator()()
218  {
219    if (send_list.size() > 0) exec_send_list();
220    if (copy_list.size() > 0) exec_copy_list();
221    if (recv_list.size() > 0) exec_recv_list();
222
223    if (req_list.size() > 0)  wait_send_list();
224
225    cleanup();
226  }
227
228
229  // Private member data.
230private:
231  typename View_of_dim<Dim, T1, Block1>::type       dst_;
232  typename View_of_dim<Dim, T2, Block2>::const_type src_;
233
234  dst_appmap_t const& dst_am_;
235  src_appmap_t const& src_am_;
236  impl::Communicator& comm_;
237
238  std::vector<Msg_record>    send_list;
239  std::vector<Msg_record>    recv_list;
240  std::vector<Copy_record>   copy_list;
241
242  std::vector<request_type> req_list;
243
244  int                       msg_count;
245
246  src_ext_type              src_ext_;
247  dst_ext_type              dst_ext_;
248};
249
250
251
252/***********************************************************************
253  Definitions
254***********************************************************************/
255
256// Overload set for send, abstracts handling of interleaved- and
257// split- complex.
258
259template <typename T>
260void
261send(
262  impl::Communicator&                            comm,
263  processor_type                                 proc,
264  T*                                             data,
265  length_type                                    size,
266  std::vector<impl::Communicator::request_type>& req_list)
267{
268  impl::Communicator::request_type   req;
269  comm.send(proc, data, size, req);
270  req_list.push_back(req);
271}
272
273
274
275template <typename T>
276void
277send(
278  impl::Communicator&                            comm,
279  processor_type                                 proc,
280  std::pair<T*, T*> const&                       data,
281  length_type                                    size,
282  std::vector<impl::Communicator::request_type>& req_list)
283{
284  impl::Communicator::request_type   req1;
285  impl::Communicator::request_type   req2;
286  comm.send(proc, data.first,  size, req1);
287  comm.send(proc, data.second, size, req2);
288  req_list.push_back(req1);
289  req_list.push_back(req2);
290}
291
292
293
294// Overload set for recv, abstracts handling of interleaved- and
295// split- complex.
296
297template <typename T>
298inline void
299recv(
300  impl::Communicator& comm,
301  processor_type      proc,
302  T*                  data,
303  length_type         size)
304{
305  comm.recv(proc, data, size);
306}
307
308
309
310template <typename T>
311inline void
312recv(
313  impl::Communicator&      comm,
314  processor_type           proc,
315  std::pair<T*, T*> const& data,
316  length_type              size)
317{
318  comm.recv(proc, data.first, size);
319  comm.recv(proc, data.second, size);
320}
321
322
323
324// Build the send_list, a list of processor-subblock-local_domain
325// records.  This can be done in advance of the actual assignment.
326
327template <dimension_type Dim,
328	  typename       T1,
329	  typename       T2,
330	  typename       Block1,
331	  typename       Block2>
332void
333Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Blkvec_assign>::build_send_list()
334{
335  profile::Scope<profile::par> scope("Par_assign<Blkvec_assign>-build_send_list");
336  processor_type rank = local_processor();
337
338  length_type dsize  = dst_am_.impl_working_size();
339  // std::min(dst_am_.num_subblocks(), dst_am_.impl_pvec().size());
340
341#if VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE >= 1
342    std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
343	      << "build_send_list(dsize: " << dsize
344	      << ") -------------------------------------\n";
345#endif
346
347  index_type src_sb = src_am_.subblock(rank);
348
349  // If multiple processors have the subblock, the first processor
350  // is responsible for sending it.
351
352  if (src_sb != no_subblock &&
353      *(src_am_.processor_begin(src_sb)) == rank)
354  {
355    assert(num_patches(src_, src_sb) == 1);
356    Domain<dim> src_dom  = global_domain(src_, src_sb, 0);
357    Domain<dim> src_ldom = local_domain (src_, src_sb, 0);
358
359    src_ext_.begin();
360
361    // Iterate over all processors
362    for (index_type pi=0; pi<dsize; ++pi)
363    {
364      processor_type proc = dst_am_.impl_proc_from_rank(pi);
365
366      // Transfers that stay on this processor is handled by the copy_list.
367      if (!disable_copy && proc == rank)
368	continue;
369
370      index_type dst_sb = dst_am_.subblock(proc);
371
372      if (dst_sb != no_subblock)
373      {
374	// Check to see if destination processor already has block
375	if (!disable_copy && processor_has_block(src_am_, proc, src_sb))
376	  continue;
377
378	assert(num_patches(dst_, dst_sb) == 1);
379	Domain<dim> dst_dom  = global_domain(dst_, dst_sb, 0);
380	Domain<dim> intr;
381
382	if (intersect(src_dom, dst_dom, intr))
383	{
384	  Index<dim>  offset   = first(intr) - first(src_dom);
385	  Domain<dim> send_dom = domain(first(src_ldom) + offset,
386					extent(intr));
387
388	  stride_type xoff   = send_dom.first()  * src_ext_.stride(0);
389	  length_type length = send_dom.length();
390	  // stride = send_dom.stride() * src_ext_.stride(0) == 1
391	  assert(send_dom.stride() * src_ext_.stride(0) == 1);
392
393	  send_list.push_back(Msg_record(proc, src_sb, xoff, length));
394
395#if VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE >= 2
396	      std::cout << "(" << rank << ") send "
397			<< rank << "/" << src_sb << "/" << 0
398			<< " -> "
399			<< proc << "/" << dst_sb << "/" << 0
400			<< " src: " << src_dom
401			<< " dst: " << dst_dom
402			<< " intr: " << intr
403			<< " send: " << send_dom
404		// << " val: " << get(local_view, first(send_dom))
405			<< std::endl;
406#endif
407	}
408	profile::Scope<profile::par> 
409          scope("Par_assign<Blkvec_assign>-build_send_list-d");
410      }
411    }
412    src_ext_.end();
413  }
414}
415
416
417
418// Build the recv_list, a list of processor-subblock-local_domain
419// records.  This can be done in advance of the actual assignment.
420
421template <dimension_type Dim,
422	  typename       T1,
423	  typename       T2,
424	  typename       Block1,
425	  typename       Block2>
426void
427Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Blkvec_assign>::build_recv_list()
428{
429  profile::Scope<profile::par> 
430    scope("Par_assign<Blkvec_assign>-build_recv_list");
431  processor_type rank = local_processor();
432
433  length_type ssize  = src_am_.impl_working_size();
434
435#if VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE >= 1
436    std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
437	      << "build_recv_list(ssize: " << ssize
438	      << ") -------------------------------------\n";
439#endif
440
441  index_type dst_sb = dst_am_.subblock(rank);
442
443  if (dst_sb != no_subblock)
444  {
445    assert(num_patches(dst_, dst_sb) == 1);
446    Domain<dim> dst_dom  = global_domain(dst_, dst_sb, 0);
447    Domain<dim> dst_ldom = local_domain (dst_, dst_sb, 0);
448
449    dst_ext_.begin();
450      
451    // Iterate over all sending processors
452    for (index_type pi=0; pi<ssize; ++pi)
453    {
454      // Rotate message order so processors don't all send to 0,
455      // then 1, etc (Currently does not work, it needs to take into
456      // account the number of subblocks).
457      // processor_type proc = (src_am_.impl_proc_from_rank(pi) + rank) % size;
458      processor_type proc = src_am_.impl_proc_from_rank(pi);
459
460      // Transfers that stay on this processor is handled by the copy_list.
461      if (!disable_copy && proc == rank)
462	continue;
463      
464      index_type src_sb = src_am_.subblock(proc);
465
466      // If multiple processors have the subblock, the first processor
467      // is responsible for sending it to us.
468
469      if (src_sb != no_subblock &&
470	  *(src_am_.processor_begin(src_sb)) == proc)
471      {
472	// Check to see if destination processor already has block
473	if (!disable_copy && processor_has_block(src_am_, rank, src_sb))
474	  continue;
475
476	assert(num_patches(src_, src_sb) == 1);
477
478	Domain<dim> src_dom  = global_domain(src_, src_sb, 0);
479	    
480	Domain<dim> intr;
481	    
482	if (intersect(dst_dom, src_dom, intr))
483	{
484	  Index<dim>  offset   = first(intr) - first(dst_dom);
485	  Domain<dim> recv_dom = domain(first(dst_ldom) + offset,
486					extent(intr));
487
488	  ptrdiff_t   xoff   = recv_dom.first()  * dst_ext_.stride(0);
489	  // stride = recv_dom.stride() * dst_ext_.stride(0) == 1
490	  assert(recv_dom.stride() * dst_ext_.stride(0) == 1);
491	  length_type length = recv_dom.length();
492
493	  recv_list.push_back(Msg_record(proc, dst_sb, xoff, length));
494	      
495#if VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE >= 2
496	      std::cout << "(" << rank << ") recv "
497			<< rank << "/" << dst_sb << "/" << 0
498			<< " <- "
499			<< proc << "/" << src_sb << "/" << 0
500			<< " dst: " << dst_dom
501			<< " src: " << src_dom
502			<< " intr: " << intr
503			<< " recv: " << recv_dom
504		// << " val: " << get(local_view, first(recv_dom))
505			<< std::endl;
506#endif
507	}
508      }
509    }
510    dst_ext_.end();
511  }
512}
513
514
515
516template <dimension_type Dim,
517	  typename       T1,
518	  typename       T2,
519	  typename       Block1,
520	  typename       Block2>
521void
522Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Blkvec_assign>::build_copy_list()
523{
524  profile::Scope<profile::par>
525    scope("Par_assign<Blkvec_assign>-build_copy_list");
526  processor_type rank = local_processor();
527
528#if VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE >= 1
529  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
530	    << "build_copy_list(num_procs: " << src_am_.num_processors()
531	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
532#endif
533
534  index_type dst_sb = dst_am_.subblock(rank);
535  if (dst_sb != no_subblock)
536  {
537    index_type src_sb = src_am_.subblock(rank);
538    if (src_sb != no_subblock)
539    {
540      assert(num_patches(dst_, dst_sb) == 1);
541      Domain<dim> dst_dom  = global_domain(dst_, dst_sb, 0);
542      Domain<dim> dst_ldom = local_domain (dst_, dst_sb, 0);
543
544      assert(num_patches(src_, src_sb) == 1);
545      Domain<dim> src_dom  = global_domain(src_, src_sb, 0);
546      Domain<dim> src_ldom = local_domain (src_, src_sb, 0);
547
548      Domain<dim> intr;
549
550      if (intersect(src_dom, dst_dom, intr))
551      {
552	Index<dim>  send_offset = first(intr) - first(src_dom);
553	Domain<dim> send_dom    = domain(first(src_ldom) + send_offset,
554					 extent(intr));
555	Index<dim>  recv_offset = first(intr) - first(dst_dom);
556	Domain<dim> recv_dom    = domain(first(dst_ldom) + recv_offset,
557					 extent(intr));
558
559	copy_list.push_back(Copy_record(src_sb, dst_sb, send_dom, recv_dom));
560
561#if VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE >= 2
562	std::cout << "(" << rank << ")"
563		  << "copy src: " << src_sb << "/" << sp
564		  << " " << send_dom
565		  << "  dst: " << dst_sb << "/" << dp
566		  << " " << recv_dom
567		  << std::endl;
568#endif
569      }
570    }
571  }
572}
573
574
575// Execute the send_list.
576
577template <dimension_type Dim,
578	  typename       T1,
579	  typename       T2,
580	  typename       Block1,
581	  typename       Block2>
582void
583Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Blkvec_assign>::exec_send_list()
584{
585  profile::Scope<profile::par>
586    scope("Par_assign<Blkvec_assign>-exec_send_list");
587
588#if VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE >= 1
589  processor_type rank = local_processor();
590  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
591	    << "exec_send_list(size: " << send_list.size()
592	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
593#endif
594  typedef typename std::vector<Msg_record>::iterator sl_iterator;
595  typedef typename src_ext_type::storage_type storage_type;
596
597  sl_iterator sl_cur = send_list.begin();
598  sl_iterator sl_end = send_list.end();
599  for (; sl_cur != sl_end; ++sl_cur)
600  {
601    processor_type proc = (*sl_cur).proc_;
602
603    src_ext_.begin();
604    send(comm_, proc,
605	 storage_type::offset(src_ext_.data(), (*sl_cur).offset_),
606	 (*sl_cur).size_, req_list);
607    src_ext_.end();
608  }
609}
610
611
612
613// Execute the recv_list.
614
615template <dimension_type Dim,
616	  typename       T1,
617	  typename       T2,
618	  typename       Block1,
619	  typename       Block2>
620void
621Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Blkvec_assign>::exec_recv_list()
622{
623  profile::Scope<profile::par>
624    scope("Par_assign<Blkvec_assign>-exec_recv_list");
625
626#if VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE >= 1
627  processor_type rank = local_processor();
628  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
629	    << "exec_recv_list(size: " << recv_list.size()
630	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
631#endif
632
633  typedef typename std::vector<Msg_record>::iterator rl_iterator;
634  typedef typename dst_ext_type::storage_type storage_type;
635
636  rl_iterator rl_cur = recv_list.begin();
637  rl_iterator rl_end = recv_list.end();
638    
639  for (; rl_cur != rl_end; ++rl_cur)
640  {
641    processor_type proc = (*rl_cur).proc_;
642
643    dst_ext_.begin();
644    recv(comm_, proc,
645	 storage_type::offset(dst_ext_.data(), (*rl_cur).offset_),
646	 (*rl_cur).size_);
647    dst_ext_.end();
648  }
649}
650
651
652
653// Execute the copy_list.
654
655template <dimension_type Dim,
656	  typename       T1,
657	  typename       T2,
658	  typename       Block1,
659	  typename       Block2>
660void
661Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Blkvec_assign>::exec_copy_list()
662{
663  profile::Scope<profile::par>
664    scope("Par_assign<Blkvec_assign>-exec_copy_list");
665
666#if VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE >= 1
667  processor_type rank = local_processor();
668  std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
669	    << "exec_copy_list(size: " << copy_list.size()
670	    << ") -------------------------------------\n";
671#endif
672
673  src_lview_type src_lview = get_local_view(src_);
674  dst_lview_type dst_lview = get_local_view(dst_);
675
676  typedef typename std::vector<Copy_record>::iterator cl_iterator;
677  for (cl_iterator cl_cur = copy_list.begin();
678       cl_cur != copy_list.end();
679       ++cl_cur)
680  {
681    view_assert_local(src_, (*cl_cur).src_sb_);
682    view_assert_local(dst_, (*cl_cur).dst_sb_);
683
684    dst_lview((*cl_cur).dst_dom_) = src_lview((*cl_cur).src_dom_);
685#if VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE >= 2
686    std::cout << "(" << rank << ") "
687	      << "src subblock: " << (*cl_cur).src_sb_ << " -> "
688	      << "dst subblock: " << (*cl_cur).dst_sb_ << std::endl
689#if VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE >= 3
690	      << dst_lview((*cl_cur).dst_dom_)
691#endif
692      ;
693#endif
694  }
695}
696
697
698
699// Wait for the send_list instructions to be completed.
700
701template <dimension_type Dim,
702	  typename       T1,
703	  typename       T2,
704	  typename       Block1,
705	  typename       Block2>
706void
707Par_assign<Dim, T1, T2, Block1, Block2, Blkvec_assign>::wait_send_list()
708{
709  typename std::vector<request_type>::iterator
710		cur = req_list.begin(),
711		end = req_list.end();
712  for(; cur != end; ++cur)
713  {
714    comm_.wait(*cur);
715  }
716  req_list.clear();
717}
718
719
720} // namespace vsip::impl
721
722} // namespace vsip
723
724#undef VSIP_IMPL_ABV_VERBOSE
725
726#endif // VSIP_CORE_PARALLEL_ASSIGN_BLOCK_VECTOR_HPP
